item.title: Switch 2 Owners Can Save Big On Dozens Of Games In The Nintendo Summer Sale
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Summer sales have begun kicking off everywhere--from GOG to Steam--and Nintendo is also throwing its hat into the commerce ring with discounts on dozens of its games. The Nintendo Summer Sale is primarily focused on digital games, and right now, there are some great deals for Switch exclusives and third-party titles from a number of studios. All of these games will work on both Switch and Switch 2 consoles, and considering that the Switch 2 has a decent amount of storage capacity, this is a nice way to fill up the library on that machine.

On the Nintendo side, Super Mario Odyssey has been discounted to $40, and considering that it just got a graphical upgrade for Switch 2, it's definitely worth picking up if you've got the new hybrid console. Super Mario 3D World + Bowser's Fury also got a free upgrade for Switch 2, and it's on sale for $40 (was $60). 3D Super Mario games are generally some of the best in any Nintendo library, and this upgraded version of the Wii U/Switch classic doesn't disappoint.

Not one to be left out, Mario's brother Luigi is also ready to rock in a discounted adventure. Luigi's Mansion 2 HD is a lovely game starring the lanky plumber as he embarks on a ghost-busting career, and you can grab this for $42. One of the biggest bargains here is for Mario + Rabbids: Sparks of Hope, as it has been discounted from $60 to $15. If you love turn-based strategy, then this is a marvelous game to pick up, especially at this price. It's charming, hilarious, and the gameplay features an impressive amount of depth to it.

We've also listed several third-party games below, so don't miss out on a chance to enjoy modern-day classics like It Takes Two, Sonic X Shadow Generations, or The Plucky Squire.

Nintendo Store Summer Sale

  • Animal Crossing: New Horizons -- $42 ($60)
  • Cult of the Lamb -- $12.49 ($25)
  • Doom Eternal -- $10 ($40)
  • Dragon Ball FighterZ -- $9.59 ($60)
  • EA Sports FC 25 -- $18 ($60)
  • Enter the Gungeon -- $3.74 ($15)
  • Fitness Boxing 3 -- $35 ($50)
  • Freedom Wars Remastered -- $30 ($40)
  • It Takes Two --$20 ($40)
  • Just Dance 2025 Edition -- $25 ($50)
  • The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening -- $42 ($60)
  • Luigi's Mansion 2 HD -- $42 ($60)
  • Mario and Rabbids: Sparks of Hope -- $15 ($60)
  • Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 -- $24 ($60)
  • Mega Man Battle Network: Legacy Collection -- $30 ($60)

  • The Plucky Squire -- $21 ($30)
  • Slay the Spire-- $8.49 ($25)
  • Sonic Superstars: Digital Deluxe Edition -- $28 ($70)
  • Sonic X Shadow Generations -- $42 ($60)
  • Skyrim Anniversary -- $28 ($70)
  • Sunderfolk --$40 ($50)
  • Super Mario 3D World + Bowser’s Fury -- $40 ($60)
  • Super Mario Odyssey -- $40 ($60)

  • Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1+2 Digital Deluxe Edition -- $20 ($50)
  • Yakuza Kiwami -- $14 ($20)
  • Xenoblade Chronicles: Definitive Edition -- $42 ($60)
  • Xenoblade Chronicles 2 -- $42 ($60)

If you're looking for a few more bargains, Best Buy and Amazon affiliate Woot are also offering big discounts on digital editions of Switch games. Some of the titles we've spotted here--that Nintendo hasn't discounted on its store yet--include massive JRPG timesinks from Atlus like Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance and Persona 5 Royal. There are also a few other Nintendo first-party heavyweights available through these stores, as Princess Peach Showtime, Super Mario Bros. Wonder, and Xenoblade Chronicles X: Definitive Edition have also seen their prices slashed.

item.title: Watch Ben Starr Date Himself In Date Everything
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Since his breakthrough role in Final Fantasy XVI, fans can't get enough of Ben Starr. Neither can he, as in a video for GameSpot, the voice actor decided to play through Date Everything by only dating his own character.

The surreal and comedic sandbox dating sim lets you literally date everything, thanks to a pair of magical glasses called Dateviators, which transform everyday household objects into dateable characters with their own stories. Each one is brought to by a huge roster of voice actors, including Ashly Burch, Matthew Mercer, Laura Bailey, Felicia Day, Steve Blum, Ashley Johnson, as well as the game's lead designer and veteran voice actor Ray Chase of Final Fantasy XV fame. Despite more than 100 dateable objects, "resident video game narcissist" Starr has opted to only date himself.

Starr actually voices multiple characters as he plays a personified door called Dorian and there are 17 variations of Dorian throughout the house. There's Front Dorian who wears a little hat, Back Dorian, which the actor said he recorded "facing away from the microphone with my hand over my mouth", as well as Trap Dorian, who happens to wear a lot less clothes than the rest.

Date Everything is considerably more lighthearted than Starr's more dramatic roles, including this year's Clair Obscur: Expedition 33. But he is no stranger to getting weird and silly, having donned costume and makeup as the Balatro jester Jimbo for a trailer announcing Balatro's Friends of Jimbo 3 update, and did the same when he collected the game's Bafta games award for best debut on behalf of developer Localthunk.

Since its release earlier this month, Date Everything has had "generally favourable" reviews on Metacritic, and "overwhelmingly positive" Steam user reviews.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/watch-ben-starr-date-himself-in-date-everything/1100-6532778/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Viral Steam Hit Bongo Cat Doesn't Actually Make Any Money
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

A game called Bongo Cat has been consistently appearing at the top of Steam's concurrent players chart in the last few months, sitting alongside long-time heavy-hitters like Counter-Strike 2 and PUBG in the top five. Yet despite regularly attracting over 150,000 concurrents, the game doesn't actually make any money, its developer has revealed in a recent interview.

Marcel Zurawka is the CEO and co-founder of Irox Games, the studio behind Bongo Cat. In a recent interview with Eurogamer, Zurawka pulled back the curtain on the game's viral success, revealing that the high player numbers haven't translated to income for the studio.

"Some people said, 'Oh you're now rich.' That's bullshit. I didn't make it for the money at all," Zurawka said. "So the first month of March, we made $2000 net, after Steam cuts and everything." He shares all of Bongo Cat's monthly income--$4050 for April, the peak of the game's virality, $3800 in May, and down to $2800 for June so far.

"It's not even paying a developer for us," he adds. "If you just look at the numbers, it's actually losing us money in the end."

Bongo Cat is a free idle game that's really more of a desktop app than an actual game. It puts a little cat on top of your task bar, who taps his paws on a counter for every key press and mouse click. Bongo Cat can discover different hats as the counter goes up, and these items can be traded on Community Marketplaces for real money--which has also resulted in elevated bot activity in the game.

Zurawka says that the money made from marketplace transactions is generally less than half of Bongo Cat's total income, with the bulk of its sales coming from paid cat skins available in the game as microtransactions.

Making money was never the goal of Bongo Cat, however. "I want to have it as an easy companion tool for everybody and don't want anyone to pay anything," Zurawka explains. "For me, it should always be as accessible as possible. I don't want to pay-wall anything."

The game's success has had a different kind of positive impact on the studio, however, acting as a marketing tool that's driven views and wishlists for the studio's next title in development, Oku.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/viral-steam-hit-bongo-cat-doesnt-actually-make-any-money/1100-6532777/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Dying Light 2 x Balatro Crossover Unleashes Jimbo The Clown For Zombie-Killing Mayhem
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Worlds will collide in the newly announced Dying Light 2 x Balatro crossover event, but Jimbo the clown looks right at home in the former. In fact, Jimbo seems positively giddy about the prospect of some zombie-killing mayhem in the announcement video for the Friend of Aiden Bundle.

This is a free bundle, and Dying Light 2 developer Techland has indicated that it can be unlocked by finding "the mysterious posters in the Bazaar and the Fish Eye." From there, players will have to solve riddles that "will test your knowledge of Villedor." This adds two new quests to the game. Once those are completed, the following items can be yours:

  • Jimbo’s Outfit--No clowning around with this outfit on, you've got a job to do: kill some zombies!
  • Ceremonial Dagger--It's no longer just a Joker. Grab the dagger and show 'em you're not bluffing! Increase your multiplier by defeating different types of enemies, performing finishers and destroying Joker Charms. Note: the multiplier is reset when the weapon is repaired, so get all you can out of it!
  • Joker Charm--Which Joker will you get? Who knows! Create a charm, and you'll receive a random one with a unique gameplay effect. Just like in Balatro, some will be more useful than others.
  • Flying Blind Paraglider--You might miss out on a few chips, but every poker player has to have an exit plan when the odds aren't looking good.

This isn't the first collaboration for Balatro, which has had previous crossovers with Dead by Daylight, Civilization VII, Critical Role, Assassin's Creed, Fallout, Bugsnax, Slay the Princess, and Rust. Balatro developer LocalThunk admitted that he only recently 100% completed his own game. Actor Jack Black has also come forward and asked players to send him their Balatro tips. Earlier this year, Balatro passed 5 million in sales across all platforms.

As for Dying Light, Techland has the next game in the franchise, Dying Light: The Beast, slated to hit PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC on August 22. Techland has also confirmed that there are no plans to bring Dying Light 2 to Nintendo Switch 2.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/dying-light-2-x-balatro-crossover-unleashes-jimbo-the-clown-for-zombie-killing-mayhem/1100-6532774/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
